fields.description:
Hi, I am using a service desk for Wastelogics which is using your infractuctuer :

[https://wastelogics.atlassian.net/]

I have several times now lost copy and attachments entered when creating tickets by using the back space key when attempting to edit text in-between actions like adding attachments that can result in deselecting the text box - which has resulted in be backspace key instructing a Brower back leaving the page with no challenge/prompt to confirm this is desired after entering continent.  Could a request/challenge please be added. 

Thanks David.
fields.summary: Warning when leaving page once form content entered

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When username have capital letter, user can't be added as request participant

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit username with capital letter. For example *Abc*
# Share the issue to user from Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results
Able to share to user.
h3. Actual Results
Return 400 error in console.
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-11 at 8.27.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes
It also happen when capital letter in the middle of the username.

h3.Workaround
Edit the username to lower case.
fields.summary: Unable to add user as Request Participant when username have capital letter

fields.description: Customers should have option to click *checkbox* to *create another request* through portal. Like the option you get when you create an issue from JIRA. Currently, after request creation they are taken to request details page.
fields.summary: Ability to create another issue via portal for customers

fields.description:
h2. Symtoms

Clicking on the 'Create sample project' in the JSD onboarding screen does not have any effect.
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Start an evaluation of JSD Cloud (tested in production).
 # In the onboarding screen (screenshot attached), click the 'Create sample project' button.

h2. Expected result

A sample project is created and the UI transitions to a new screen.
h2. Actual result

Nothing gets created and the UI stays in the same screen (although analytics events are sent, as revealed by the Network panel of the browser Developer Tools).

I have tried both Chrome and Safari, with the same result.

The other buttons in the onboarding screen seem to be working fine.
fields.summary: 'Create sample project' button in JSD onboarding screen does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
People page unable to load when having a lot of user in People.

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open *People* page.


h3. Expected Results
Able to load the page
h3. Actual Results
Get below error in Console :-
{noformat}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 504 ()
{noformat}
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-08 at 9.38.15 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: People page can't be load and return 504 error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the Service Desk report gadget is preconfigured with reports and date range and does not allow users to create a report based on exact JQL definitions.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow to configure the Service Desk report gadget using custom JQL
h3. Why this is important
It would allow more customized reports for actual monitoring and progression of the team.
fields.summary: Allow to configure the Service Desk report gadget using JQL

fields.description:
h3. Current Behavior

If the Service Desk portal is accessed anonymously, an 'Email confirmation to' field will show up on the portal. Given that this is not included on the request type form by the SD Admins, they will not be able to rename the field as they wish.
h3. Desired Behavior

As a Service Desk admin, I would like to have the ability to rename this field.
fields.summary: Ability to rename the 'Email confirmation to' field on anonymous portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when on the Confluence page have "Table of Contents Macro", it is not displayed in the widget.

h3. Suggested Solution
"Table of Contents Macro" display in the widget

h3. Why this is important
 It is important to display the "Table of Contents Macro". It is easier for user to access the content.
fields.summary: Allow widget to display Confluence "Table of Contents Macro"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

Portal users might require an Instruction(s) or assistance to fill a particular fields.
h3. Suggestions

Include function to display read-only text next to portal's field text box.
 Good example is from Atlassian site:


 !screenshot-1.png!
fields.summary: Allow read-only text next to portal's fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Adding read-only text next to the request fields would allow Service Desk administrator to include an idea or instructions which assists portal users on what to input. 

h3. Suggestions
Include a native function for Service Desk administrator to include read-only text next to Request fields similar to Atlassian Form:
 !image-2017-12-07-13-21-15-846.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow adding read only text besides fields in customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, customer have option to disable notification for specific issue. But, this is crucial if the business doesn't want to allow their customer to disable notification.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to remove the link and don't allow customer to disable notification.

h3. Why this is important
Customer need to get all notification.
fields.summary: Option to hide "Don't Notify Me" link from Customer Portal

fields.description:
When an inactive user lodges a request through the widget, the user is presented with a success message.  The request fails later when the request is created.

Suggest to add a check before submitting the request to make sure the user account is active.
fields.summary: Report when a request being lodged by inactive user

fields.description: Currently JSD only allow you to link Confluence on the same domain as the knowledge base, I would like to connect my JSD Cloud instance to my Confluence Server instance as knowledge base.
fields.summary: Support linking Confluence Server instances as knowledge base on Jira Service Desk Cloud

fields.description: Currently JSD only allow you to link Confluence on the same domain as the knowledge base, I would like to connect my JSD Cloud instance to my Confluence Cloud instance on a different domain as knowledge base.
fields.summary: Support linking non same domain JSD Cloud instances as knowledge base

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Field help does not show correctly on the customer portal when using chrome on mobile.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the customer portal through the phone on chrome.
 # Click on the form to open a request
 # The fields show correctly but the field help (if the message is too long) does not show on the screen.

h3. Expected Results

Field help shows the full message
h3. Actual Results

Field help opens but the box out of the screen (see attached screenshot)
h3. Notes

It was possible to reproduce on Android and IOS using the latest version of chrome.
h3. Workaround

Rotate the screen horizontally and then rotate vertically again will fix the field to show correctly, but it's necessary to do it every time the form is opened.
fields.summary: Field help does not show correctly on the customer portal when using chrome on mobile.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Reset password email does not open the option to set the new password.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a customer, go to the portal login page and insert the email and click next
# Click on "Forgot your password?"

h3. Expected Results

The customer receives the email, click on "Reset my password" and on the page that opens, change the password.

h3. Actual Results

A page with the error 500 appears (see attached screenshot):

{code}

<status>
<status-code>500</status-code>
<message>
class com.atlassian.crowd.model.user.IdentityPlatformUser declares multiple JSON fields named user
</message>

{code}

h3.Workaround
An admin can create a password for the customer through user management.
fields.summary: Reset password email does not open the option to set the new password

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On moving Issue from a non Service Desk project to a  Service Desk project, JIRA doesn't check if the assignee is an agent. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a Business/Software project
 # Assign the created issue to a non-agent
 # Move Issue from Business/Software project to Service Desk project

h3. Expected Results


Assignee field should be left blank as they original assignee doesn't have permission in Service Desk project or do not allow the issue to be moved without changing the assignee
h3. Actual Results

The original assignee is still assigned the issue in Service Desk project although the user is not an agent


h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Non-agents remain as an assignee when a ticket is moved from a Business/Software project to a Service Desk project.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It's not possible to set up fields from JavaScripit in JSD widget. Currently, it's only possible to accomplish this with Issue Collector.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful if Jira admin could set up field from JavaScript in Jira Service Desk widgets.
fields.summary: Allow setting fields from JavaScript in JIRA Service Desk widget

fields.description:
h3. Current Behavior.

JIRA Service Desk Widget does not display a few custom field types, such as URL and Labels. Including an unsupported field type on the request type form will throw the following message on the Widget configuration:

!Screen Shot 2017-11-29 at 12.00.59 PM.png|thumbnail!

If the Widget is embedded on a website:
 * Having an unsupported field on the default request type will cause the widget to fail to load (help button won't show)
 * If request type search is turned on, having an unsupported field on one of the search result will cause an error to be shown when searching

h3. Desired Behavior.

As a Service Desk admin, I would like to be able to include those fields on the widget form.
h3. Currently supported fields
 * System fields: Summary, Description, Priority, Components, Fix Version/s, Attachments
 * Custom fields: Single & multi line text, Single & multi select, Radio, Checkbox
fields.summary: Support additional Custom Fields on JSD Widget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Requests created via widgets are registered to Created by com.atlassian.servicedesk.embedded
The notification emails that the end users receive show the sender as com.atlassian.servicedesk.embedded - this too is potentially problematic for some email system that are expecting email notifications to come from a specific email address and name, such as a the email address that sent the message.

h3. Suggested Solution
Set the creator as reporter instead
Or provide an option to allow a JSD admin to set the value of the sender for these messages.

h3. Why this is important
As the creator is set as com.atlassian.servicedesk.embedded, the From address of the notification will be sent from com.atlassian.servicedesk.embedded
fields.summary: Notifications for issues created via the JSD widget should have a configurable email sender address

fields.description:
-*Issues while using the swim lane view of the Kanban board*-
 * -Stories without subtasks are displayed at the bottom, even if they are of higher priority than other stories-
 * -Only subtasks can be dragged and dropped within the swim lane, updating story status is a hassle-

-*Suggestion to resolve this*-
 * -Always display a swim lane for a story, even if it has no subtasks-
 * -Have a shadow task for the story in the swim lane to allow easy story status manipulation-
 * -Hide the story shadow task if the lane is not empty, display it if it otherwise would be empty-
 * -Have a "display shadow task" toggle close to the story (possibly directly besides the "Toggle swimlane visibility")-
fields.summary: Display shadow item for Stories in the Swim Lane view of the Kanban board

fields.description: Project yang pernah dibuat dan tiba-tiba menghilang. setelah create project baru dengan client yang sama project yang lama muncul kembali. hal ini menimbulkan kebingungan. terimakasih
fields.summary: List Project Menghilang

fields.description: There should be an option to have the announcement automatically removed at a certain date/time like an expiration.
fields.summary: announcement banner expiration date/time for customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Under certain requirement, it is necessary for the Customer Portal to display the work log to Customers

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the Work Log field to be added to the Customer Portal
fields.summary: View Work Log in Customer Portal

fields.description:
As a Service Desk customer I would like the ability to watch a page in a connected knowledge base.

Currently Confluence can be opened to allow only customers to see articles, but this does not come with the ability to watch a page.
fields.summary: Allow service desk customers to watch a page in a connected knowledge base

fields.description:
h2. Summary
On the Customer Portal, total number of My requests on the right corner doesn't take into an account Issue Security level. In other words, it's showing invalid number which contains the tickets that the user doesn't have the access.

h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create JSD project, create issue security schema (for example. not allow to see ticket if you are not agent)
 # Create Organisation and put Customers and agent to it
# Lets say there are right now 5 open tickets by customer
 # Create ticket1, share with the Organisation
 # Apply Security level created before

h2. Expected results
"My requests" contains number of tickets which customer can see and doesn't include those tickets hidden behind security level.
So, total number is 5

h2. Actual results
User can see total number of tickets including those which he has no access to see
Total number is 6
fields.summary: Total number of requests is not taking into an account Issue Security level

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce:
 # Create a user with no application access or convert customer to Atlassian Account
 # Go to the service desk customer portal: https://<instance>/servicedesk/
 # Click on avatar > Profile
# Click on the Atlassian Account link:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Expected Behaviour
Redirect to https://id.atlassian.com

h3. Actual Behaviour
Redirect back to home: https://<instance>/servicedesk/customer/portals

h3. Workaround
Directly go to https://id.atlassian.com

h3. Notes
This doesn't affect users with application access.
fields.summary: Update your account details through Atlassian account link in Customer portal does not redirect to id.atlassian.com when logging in as JIRA Service Desk customer

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Create two feature requests: *Help With technical questions* and *Report a Bug*
 * Create a Widget in your Service Desk project, turning on the options *Show all request Types in the Widget* and *Show Knowledge Base in the Widget*
 * Add the Default Request type as **Help With technical questions**
 * Add the Widget code to a web page
 * There is no way to search for an empty value in the field
 * If you Search for 'a', 'b' or 'c' in the widget, both request types are returned
 * If you search for 'd', only the Default Request type is returned, although it does not have the 'd' letter in its title or description

 

Expected results:
 * The list should return all request types, regardless the parameter inserted in the *Search field*

 

Current Results:
 - The Default issue Type is returned not mattering the search you perform, however, there is no way to search for *All Request Types*. It is impacting customers that do not know which are the request types available on JIRA.
fields.summary: Search field in Service Desk Widgets return incoherent information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is only possible to add 20 series to [custom reports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/setting-up-service-desk-reports-732528965.html].  
*  !Add a series.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have possibility to add more series.
fields.summary: Have possibility to add more then 20 series in custom reports

fields.description:
h4. Summary

The customer notification for Jira Service Desk newly created projects for comment on transition is coming doubled (Public Comment notification), the customer receives the same information twice on a notification email:

{quote}
—-—-—-—
Reply above this line.

User commented:

The summary is magic.
----
User commented:

The summary is magic.
{quote}

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Jira Service Desk project of any of the available templates.
# Raise a ticket and make a transition with a screen to add a comment together.

h5. Expected behaviour

A notification is triggered for the transition comment through email.

h5. Actual result

Two notifications are triggered for the transition comment through email.

h4. Notes

Normal comments on the issue do not trigger the bug.
Automation that sends email also sends duplicated message on the email body.
fields.summary: The customer notification for Jira Service Desk newly created projects for comment on transition is coming doubled (Public Comment notification)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service desk reports are not editable when the report has a JQL which is using a deleted request type.
h3.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Request Type, eg: "Bug"
 # Create Report with a JQL filtering "Bug" request type
 # Delete the Request Type = "Bug"

h3. Expected Results

The request type is removed from the report too.
h3. Actual Results

The request type is deleted from the project but maintains in the report causing the report not editable.
h3. Notes

The report is editable if the same request type exist in other projects. The bug only appears when the request type does not exist in the site.
h3. Workaround

Add back the deleted request type, edit the report to remove the unwanted request type, save and remove the unwanted request type again.
fields.summary: Report not editable when request types used by report is deleted

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the Service Desk widget appears as a pop-up in external sites where it is embedded.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the widget to be embedded into a fixed location on the external site.
fields.summary: Allow to embed the widget into a fixed location in the site instead of appearing as a pop-up

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no option to change widget font style and color. It's hardly to read the text if the background color is light color.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide options to configure font style and color.

h3. Why this is important
Provide flexibility for admin to set widget font style and color.
fields.summary: Allow admin to change the widget font style and color

fields.description: !Image.png!
fields.summary: Add Ticket # to Browser Tab Like Standard Jira

fields.description:
The "Comment is primary action" condition in automation for Service Desk is not working, tickets are being reopened when a comment is added via workflow transition.

h2. How to replicate

# Create an automation with the and IF as "Comment is primary action",
# Create a service desk ticket
# Close the ticket and add a comment via workflow transitin

h2. Expected results

The automation will not run

h2. Current results

The automation will run considering the comment a primary action.
fields.summary: The "Comment is primary action" condition in automation for Service Desk is not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When customers search the portal or help center, they see related articles that might help them troubleshoot their problem, however, JIRA will only suggest related articles when the customer start type any text on Portal *Search* field or when they use form's *Summary* field.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if JIRA suggests related articles when customers start to type in the *Description* field as well.

h3. Workaround
There is no available workaround.
fields.summary: Include terms from the Description field in knowledge base auto-search at the Customer Portal

fields.description:
The embedded widget can be configured at {{[https://XXX.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/YYY/addon/com.atlassian.servicedesk.embedded__settings|https://xxx.atlassian.net/servicedesk/admin/YYY/addon/com.atlassian.servicedesk.embedded__settings]}}, but it is hard to know how the widget will look, since there is no preview. See attachment.

This is especially bad since the only way to see it is to copy the script snippet from the configuration page and then transfer the data in the clipboard to an HTML file in some other system, e.g. to our web-server.

It would be much better if a preview of the widget was visible on the configuration page.
fields.summary: Show preview of the embedded widget in its configuration page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the REST API only allows creating new customers.
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-customer-post

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a REST API to edit the customer's information like the name and email

h3. Why this is important
If you have multiple users to update doing it using the API will be faster and less expensive than having to edit all customers one by one through the UI

h3. Workaround 
Edit on the UI
fields.summary: Update customer using REST API on Jira Service Desk Cloud

fields.description:
Currently, the REST API only allows me to create customer.
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-customer-post

However, i would like to know if there's a way I can update an existing customer using this API ? => change the name, etc.

And alors i want to create a new customer key/value for this user ? i can do that using the UI, but i need the feature in REST API.
fields.summary: Update customer using REST API

fields.description: After moving an issue from Project A to Project B, the project says that it is Project A but the issue list relates to Project B. If you then refresh the page, it will show Project B. Ideally the screen should either show Project B fully or Project A fully. My usage has been such that I would prefer to remain in Project A.
fields.summary: Allow user to remain in existing project after moving a single issue into a different project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service desk customer doesn't receive notification even though added to Issue Security as "Reporter".
h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project
 # Configure the project to allow anyone to raise a request
 # Create an Issue Security Scheme which grants permission to "Reporter" to see the ticket
 # Associate the scheme to the project as *default*
 # As a Service Desk Agent, create a service desk ticket on behalf of a non-existing customer

h3. Expected Results

If service desk customer is added to Issue Security as "Reporter", he/she should receive notification based on view permission.
h3. Actual Results

Service desk customer doesn't receive notification if he/she is added to Issue Security as "Reporter".
h3. Notes

Since Jira Service Desk doesn't take account of Jira field (such as reporter), this behavior can be regarded as specification. If so, Issue Security configuration page better to warn this counterintuitive behavior explicitly.
h3. Workaround

You need to add the Project Role "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" instead of "Reporter" to Issue Security.
fields.summary: Customer notification doesn't take account of "Reporter" in Issue Security

fields.description: When a user emails the support email address, the user is then added to the customer list for the project. We would like to be able move that user to an organization in the project. Either with drag and drop or a "move" option for the user. The ticket allows for an organization to be added to it, but it does not affect the user. We'd like to be able to move the user so if in the future they log in, they are only seeing tickets for their organization and not all open tickets.
fields.summary: Allow admin to move customers into organizations

fields.description:
Allow the "Then" actions in JSD to move issues to other projects.

I have multiple situations where the JSD Automation is able to detect instances where certain issues will be handled in other projects, but cannot move them there.
fields.summary: Allow automation rule actions to move issues to new projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users cannot be found when selecting the add comment action in the THEN section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation, in the THEN section, select the Add comment for the action.
# Mention a user in the comment section using "@"

h3. Expected Results
Valid users upon search will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
_Found no matching users for *UserSearch*_
Console showing _Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 ()_
 
h3. Notes
The workaround would still mention the user and notification still works.

h3.Workaround
It is still possible to mention the user by copying the users exact username, eg: {code}[~SomeUser]{code}
fields.summary: Unable to select users to mention in comments when setting automation

fields.description:
{panel:title=Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i) At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
{panel:title=Product team update 21 April 2021}
Hey all, 

Small update here. I am evaluating this request as a part of a broader Customer Management strategy. Our focus is to improve the experience of managing customers. 

The soonest I will be able to provide an update for this issue again will be the start of the new FY (July 2021).

In the meanwhile I might reach out for some feedback on this issue, or one of the related "managing customer email address" requests.

Cheers, 

Ben.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

There's no easy way to change the customer's email address.
h3. Suggested Solution

For the Jira Service desk administrators to have the ability to change the customer's e-mail address and retain all the issues that is in progress.
h3. Workaround

Try migrating the customer account to "Atlassian account":
 # Login as a site-admin
 # Operate *migrate to Atlassian account* for the portal customer account in question
 ** !Screen Shot 2020-10-02 at 17.48.05.png|thumbnail!
 # Optional: maybe you want to disable the product access for the account. But make sure to keep *Has access on site* enabled.
 ** !Screen Shot 2020-10-02 at 17.49.34.png|thumbnail!

With that, now the user can change the email address at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/email].

Besides, consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Change the customer e-mail address

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Brackets [] on the file name does not render on the comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a txt file (or another type) with brackets on the name e.g. txtfile[brackets].txt
# Attach the file on the ticket and it will show [^txtfile[brackets].txt]

h3. Expected Results

It shows a link for the customer to download on the portal.

h3. Actual Results

It shows the [^txtfile[brackets].txt] only instead of a clickable link.

h3.Workaround

Edit the file name and remove the brackets.
fields.summary: Brackets [ ] on the file name does not render on the comment.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When customers try to transition issues from the Customer Portal they get an error on some transitions.

{panel:title=Error}
We were unable to submit your request. Please refresh the page and try again. Note that this will clear your request details.

If you have already tried again, tell us about this issue.
{panel}

 
h3. Notes
This is actually cased by the Jira Toolkit Plugin, by its *Username of last updater or commenter* module, and it's exactly the same issue as https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JTOOL-238
However the fix to the bug above was just pushed to the Server version of the plugin, whereas the Cloud version is still affected by this.
fields.summary: Renamed users are unable to transition issue from the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the ${request.sharedwith} variable is used in a notification template, the notification will only consist of 3 names, followed by *and X other people*
!sd.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggestion

It would be best that this is configurable, for example to display all users or any number of names configured
fields.summary: Configurable number of users displayed for the "Request shared with" variable (${request.sharedwith}) in Service Desk notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
This is a link bug with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5741.

When priority is deleted from Priorities setting, the series tied to the priority can't be remove. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk Application 3.3.0-OD-1000.2484.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create "Highest" and "Lowest" priority in *Priorities* configuration.
# Then, add both priority in *Problems by priority* report 
# Remove "Highest" and "Lowest" priority in *Priorities* configuration.
# Then, remove the "Highest" series from the report.

h3. Expected Results
Able to remove it.

h3. Actual Results
Unable to remove it.


h3.Workaround
# Add back "Highest" and "Lowest" priority in Priorities configuration.
# Then, remove or edit the series from the report.
# Then, remove back the priority in Priorities configuration if not needed.
fields.summary: Unable to remove series setting in "Problems by priority" reports if the "Priority" deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a few priority is deleted from "Priorities" configuration, editing priority value from *Problems by priority* report displayed inconsistent error. 

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk Application 3.3.0-OD-1000.2484.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create "Highest" and "Lowest" priority in *Priorities* configuration.
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-15 at 10.40.53 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then, add both priority in *Problems by priority* report 
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-15 at 10.46.22 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Remove "Highest" and "Lowest" priority in *Priorities* configuration.
# Edit the "Highest" priority in the report.

h3. Expected Results
Error display {{The value 'Highest' does not exist for the field 'priority'.}}

h3. Actual Results
Instead of showing 'Highest' value , it display :-
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-15 at 10.49.25 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Inconsistent error display when editing "Problems by priority" report

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The customer wants to create a custom field where the users can select multiple values to the field.
Currently, there's the field type *Select list (multiple choices)*, but it's design is too different from every other field, it does not follow the pattern of other fields. That causes it to be *"not user-friendly"*.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great to have a custom field with the same functionality as the *Select list (multiple choices)*, but displayed like the *Component/s* field (with limited options of values), for example (in line with dropdown, and the ability of filtering results).

Basically, you would be able to create that custom field (Multiple choice dropdown list) and create it's possible values, just like you do when creating the *Select list (multiple choices)* custom field.  

It could be described as the label field with limited possible values (the ones you create) and with no possibility of creating new values (like it happens when you type a different value in the label field).

h3. Why this is important

It would make the overall design more user friendly, for it feels that the *Select list (multiple choices)* field should not even be there, his design is way more distinct and occupies too much space in the screen.
Keeping patterns helps keeping the UI user-friendly.
fields.summary: Multiple choices dropdown list

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers are facing an error message when trying to reseat Portal Only User's password.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Access Site Administration > Jira Service Desk > Portal Only Customers
 # Select a user
 # Click on *Reset password* button

h3. Expected results

A screen to change user's password should be displayed.
h3. Actual result

The error message is displayed: We're having some trouble connecting. If refreshing the page doesn't fix it, then this might be one for the experts.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Reset Password button is not working at Site Administration - Portal Only Customers session

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a ticket by email and adding request participants in 'cc', those don't get the *Request created* notification even though the *Customer Notifications* settings are set to be sent to all *Customers involved*. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set *Customer notifications* for *Request created* event to be sent to all *Customers involved*
# Send an email to create a new ticket adding other customers in cc.

h3. Expected Results
All customers involved, including request participants, should get the issue created notification.


h3. Actual Results
Only the reporter of the issue gets this notification.

h3.Workaround
Enable the *Participants added* notification for all *Customers involved*. Then the request participants will get that notification instead.
fields.summary: When creating a ticket by email and adding request participants in 'cc', those don't get the create issue customer notification
When creating a ticket by email and adding request participants in 'cc', they don't get the create issue customer notification

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, widget only allow default field which is "Description" and "Summary"

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to add :-
# Custom Field
# Name
# Organization

h3. Why this is important
Provide flexibility for admin to add extra fields.
fields.summary: Ability to add additional field in widget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, admin can't get web client information when issue created from the widget.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide web client information to admin.

h3. Why this is important
Admin needs the information to track it.
fields.summary: Ability to get web client information when issue created from widget and Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in JSD widget it only allows using email. 

h3. Suggested Solution
For existing customer, they can use the username.

h3. Why this is important
 Easier for existing customer to use widget
fields.summary: Ability to use username for existing customer in widget

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When click "Search knowledge base" link , it will pop up a screen to search the KB. However, it can't be closed. It also causes other pop up can't be closed too. For example, after click "Search knowledge base" link, then click *Edit* button to edit the issue. When canceling the screen, it can't be closed.

h3. Environment
Jira fb3a7a83

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JSD issue
# Click "Search knowledge base" link 
# Then, try to close the pop up.
# Then, click *Edit* to pop up another screen. 
# Then, try to close it too. 

h3. Expected Results
Pop up screen should be able to close it.

h3. Actual Results
Pop up screen can't be close
 
h3.Workaround
Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Knowledge Base pop up in Issue View screen can't be closed

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Pasting screenshots with the same name in the Customer Portal will not display the images correctly.
h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
 # Create a new request via Customer Portal.
 # Take a screenshot anywhere and paste it to the request by using shortcut key Ctrl + V, example name of the screenshot would be {{image.png}}.
 # Take another screenshot and paste it again. The name of the second screenshot might also be {{image.png}}.
 # Upload the screenshots.

h3. Expected result

Two different screenshots will be uploaded and displayed
h3. Actual result

Two screenshots are uploaded, however, they look exactly the same in the request. However, the screenshots are uploaded correctly to JIRA and displayed correctly in the JIRA issue
h3. Workaround

Use tools to take screenshots which will give different names to the image. For example, the print screen tool of a MacBook machine will use the timestamp when the image is taken as the name of the file instead of a generic name

 
h3. Exact Version (Cloud)
JIRA Service Desk Application 3.3.0-OD-1000.2476.0
fields.summary: Pasting screenshots with the same name will result in 'duplicated' images shown on the request

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create JIRA SD project and link to a Confluence Space with KBs.
 # On KB X, add a TOC Macro and add headers for the macro to reference. i.e. Heading 1. Make sure that the TOC macro has (absolute urls turned on).
 # Wrap the TOC Macro in an Excerpt Macro
 # On KB Y, insert an Excerpt Include referencing KB X
 # Go to the customer portal and search for KB X and Y.
 # Click on the anchor links from KB X.
 # Click on the anchor link from KB Y.

*Expected result*
 Clicking on the links from KB X should redirect to the respective KBs as the links on the titles do, or like the link from KB Y.

*Actual result*
 When clicking on KB Y link, it reopens the KB as a document. When clicking on the anchor links from KB X, it redirects to the customer portal.
h3. Notes:

It seems to be related to the previously reported Confluence bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53948, but it seems to be affecting linked KBs only.
h3. Workaround

Use normal anchor links without the Macro as on KB Y.
fields.summary: Anchor links don't work with the Excerpt macro on Knowledge Bases

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attachments added via email size displays as 0.0KB

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment via email to a Service Desk ticket by sending an email with attachment

h3. Expected Results
Attachment size shows as the attachment actual size.
h3. Actual Results
Attachment size shows as 0.0Kb
 
h3. Notes
- Downloading the file would return the file with the actual size.
- A 0.0Kb sized file indicates a file is empty/corrupted refraining users from downloading the file.

h3.Workaround
Add attachment via Issue view/portal
fields.summary: Attachments added via email size displays as 0.0KB

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Post-function allows tickets to be assigned to non-agents

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a post-function to assign issue to *Reporter*
# Create a ticket and make sure the ticket reporter is a non-licensed agent
# Transition the issue to trigger the post-function

h3. Expected Results
Issue to throw an error/information that transition cannot be done due to non-agents cannot be assigned tickets
h3. Actual Results
Ticket assigned to the reporter
 
h3. Notes
- The same behaviour observed for post-function to assign issues to User custom field or copy field *assignee* from custom field.
- The issue cannot be transitioned if the post-function has a screen.
- The same problem observed where users without the Assignable User permission can be assigned the issue.
fields.summary: Post-function allows Service Desk tickets be assigned to non-licensed agents

fields.description:
h3. I need to be able to specify a set of agents to only work on specific customers.


h3. The ability to set permissions to make group of agents work on specific Customer. 


h3. Create separate Projects and set the project permission to be accessible via the needed agents.
fields.summary: Restriction access agents to organizations (customers)

fields.description:
My user was deactivated but I still have access to the Customer portal/Profile page. I cannot see any ticket I created.
It's not clear why I dont have any access anymore. There are also 2 links - Update password and update AA but when I click on the I'm redirected back to the main page of the Portal with the message that I dont have access to it.
 !Ariadna_Romanenko__X__-_Service_Desk.png|thumbnail! 

Steps to reproduce:
# Invite AA user as a customer to your project, let him create few tickets
# Deactivate AA user
# As AA go to the Customer Portal

Expected results: 
# User can still see his own created tickets (no action allowed)
# There is a clear message why user cannot see/do anything - because his account was inactivated
# User still can go to his AA page

Actual results:
# User doesnt' see any ticket
# User cannot understand what is going on
# User can click to AA links but not redirected to a proper place
fields.summary: If AA user is inactive it's not clear what he/she can do

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Currently, the widget is displayed as a (?) when embedded on a web site and depending on which kind of support or service requests the Service Desk provides, it is not clear what it means at first sight.

h4. Suggestion

Allow JSD project administrators to customise the widget button, allowing to put text on it to make more clear what the button is about.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Service Desk administrators to customise the Widget symbol (?)

fields.description:
Login page, error page do not have "Powered by Service desk" footer
 !Login_-_Service_Desk.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Service Desk foot is not presented on Customer portal on some pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem

After I add one new request type, I cannot add another one (buttons are disabled)

h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
 # Create a new request type (go to Project Settings-> Request Types-> Group)
 # Try to add another request type to the same group

h3. Expected result
It is possible to add second request type 
h3. Actual result

You cannot add another request type
 !Basic_-_Edit_Request_Type_Group_-_Service_Desk.png|thumbnail! 
{code:sql}context-sd.admin.request.type.group-b017027d9481adb85daa.js?locale=en-US:1 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'split' of undefined
    at d._getTourType (context-sd.admin.request.type.group-b017027d9481adb85daa.js?locale=en-US:1)
    at d.handleRequestTypeAdded (context-sd.admin.request.type.group-b017027d9481adb85daa.js?locale=en-US:1)
    at x (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:91)
    at d.trigger (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:89)
    at d.addRow (context-sd.admin.request.type.group-b017027d9481adb85daa.js?locale=en-US:1)
    at d.<anonymous> (context-sd.admin.request.type.group-b017027d9481adb85daa.js?locale=en-US:1)
    at x (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:91)
    at d.trigger (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:89)
    at success (context-sd.admin.request.type.group-b017027d9481adb85daa.js?locale=en-US:1)
    at Object.c.success (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true&simplifiedUxOptinAvailable=true:97){code}
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page
fields.summary: Cannot add 2 new request types in a row

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you're configuring the project Widget (Project settings > Widget) one of the settings options is to "Show all request types in the widget", which gives us the impression that when we open the widget in the web page its in all the request types will be shown without the need to type anything for them to show up, however when the open the widget it doesn't show all the request types available for the selected project, just the ones that match the seach.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Widget in the project
# Copy its code and save on an html file
# Open this html file and type some word and press Enter for the widget to open

h3. Expected Results
When the widget opens all the request types would be shown as the "Show all request types in the widget" setting implies.
h3. Actual Results
Only one or a few request types are shown, not all of them.
 

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: "Show all request types in the widget" option doesn't actually show all request types in the widget

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a workflow that requires more than one approval step, A & B, The waiting for approval list for step B will still be displayed when it is already approved if step A is not yet approved


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a workflow with two approval steps, step A & step B
# Add different approvers for step A and step B
# Create an issue using the workflow, transition to step B without approving step A and proceed to issue closure.

h3. Expected Results
No more pending issues for step B approver
h3. Actual Results
The issue is still pending step B approver
 
h3. Notes
If Step A is approved, the issue will no longer appear as pending for both step A & B approvers.
Approval shown in the approval list even though the step does not require that approval yet.
As soon as an approval is required for either steps, it will show for all users which have approvals on other steps too.
fields.summary: Waiting for approvals still displayed after approval if another approval is required on another step

fields.description:
As a Service Desk customer I would like the ability to watch a page in a connected knowledge base.

Currently Confluence can be opened to allow only customers to see articles, but this does not come with the ability to watch a page.
fields.summary: Allow service desk customers to watch a page in a connected knowledge base

fields.description: I have created a custom email address for my clients to raise issues on the Service Desk  like [support@mycompany.com.|mailto:support@mycompany.com.] This works fine for raising issues, but responses from Service Desk always come from the default email support@mycompany.atlassian.net, which is confusing to my clients. Is there any chance JIRA Service Desk Cloud can also send emails "From" [support@mycompany.com|mailto:support@mycompany.com.]? I understand I might have to verify the email using DNS, I am used and do it for my clients too.
fields.summary: Send Emails from Custom Email Address

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Pasting screenshots with the same name in the Customer Portal will not display the images correctly.
h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
 # Create a new request via Customer Portal.
 # Take a screenshot anywhere and paste it to the request by using shortcut key Ctrl + V, example name of the screenshot would be {{image.png}}.
 # Take another screenshot and paste it again. The name of the second screenshot might also be {{image.png}}.
 # Upload the screenshots.

h3. Expected result

Two different screenshots will be uploaded and displayed
h3. Actual result

Two screenshots are uploaded, however, they look exactly the same in the request. However, the screenshots are uploaded correctly to JIRA and displayed correctly in the JIRA issue
h3. Workaround

Use tools to take screenshots which will give different names to the image. For example, the print screen tool of a MacBook machine will use the timestamp when the image is taken as the name of the file instead of a generic name. 

Also, the problem doesn't happen if the user drag and drop the attachment or use the attach icon.
fields.summary: Pasting screenshots with the same name will result in 'duplicated' images shown on the request

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Issues created with approvers are failing to send the Approval Required notification for customers, the issue is intermittent.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Have a project that has an approval required checked on a status on the workflow.
# Create a ticket on the customer portal that has an approvers field to be filled

h5. Expected behaviour

The approvers listed should receive the notification for awaiting approval.

h5. Actual result

Sometimes the event to send the notification will not be created.

h4. Notes

It does not affect the notification when an approver is added afterwards.

It either works for all approvers or for none.
fields.summary: Issues created with approvers are failing to send the Approval Required notification. (Intermittent)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Automation to "Transition on comment" is not running due to Security Level.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create an automation to transition on comment.
Set to run as the user who triggered the rule.
The customer creates an issue on a project with a security level.
The customer adds a comment on the ticket.

h3. Expected Results

The ticket is transitioned to support.

h3. Actual Results

The automation does not run and the ticket keeps on the customer side.
 
h3.Workaround

Set the automation to run as project default.
fields.summary: Automation to "Transition on comment" is not running due to Security Level

fields.description:
Hi,

Jira Service Desk application running our cloud, licence will expired sooner, Could you clarify below mentioned query's.

1) what kind of assistance will get from you after licence expired?.

2) JIRA SD would work normal, if licence update isn't done on time? 

3) if licence expired, portal customer & Service desk user could able to work on there corresponding projects tickets.    

4) if licence expired, what are the impact could you share briefly?.

 

Please refer the JIRA SD Support entitlement number (SEN)SEN-8641032.

 

Regards

Yuvaraj u
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Support After Licence Expired

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, all Jira Service Desk(JSD) agents are able to indiscriminately add customers to a JSD project.  As JSD uses a single customer user base, tracking who is adding which customers is difficult.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow JSD administrators to assign "create customer" permissions to users/groups/roles

h3. Why this is important
* Allows JSD administrators more control on how customers are added to a JSD project
* Customer creations can be hard to track as all JSD projects within a given instance use a single user base
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: As a Service Desk administrator, I would like to be able to restrict Agents from being able to add customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a portal-only user log into the site (non portal URL like [https://example.atlassian.net]), the user gets the message "Your email address user@gmail.com doesn't have access to example.atlassian.net".

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a customer account (with Portal-only access)
# Log into https://id.atlassian.com
# Access the site, eg: https://example.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results
User will automatically get redirected to the portal page. If the credential is not accepted, it should show the login page of the portal: [https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/login?destination=portals].

h3. Actual Results
An error message shows that the user doesn't have the access to the site.
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Add {{/servicedesk}} at the end of the URL, like https://example.atlassian.net/servicedesk.
fields.summary: Customer Didn't Get Auto Redirected to Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"More" and "Advanced" labels overlapping on automation rule edit

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your JIRA interface to the new experience
# Create a SD Project
# Go to settings
# Automation
# Create rule
# Custom rule
# When "Issue created" > If "Issue matches" 

h3. Expected Results
The "More" and "Advanced" options should be displayed in the edit rule menu.

h3. Actual Results
The text overlaps existing UI fields:
!Screen Shot 2017-11-03 at 8.59.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: "More" and "Advanced" labels overlapping on automation rule edit

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Shortcut ALT + E opens Chrome menu instead of post a public comment on JIRA Service Desk, when using Windows 10.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a ticket on the instance
# Type a comment and press CTRL + E to "Share with customer".

h3. Expected Results

The public comment is posted.

h3. Actual Results

It opens Chrome menu and the comment is not posted.

h3.Workaround

Click "Share with customer".
fields.summary: Shortcut ALT + E opens Chrome menu instead of post a public comment

fields.description:
When clicking a link in a ticket, I nearly always want it to open in a new tab. It would be helpful if links took you to a new tab instead of redirecting you in the same tab. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Links take you to new tab

fields.description: We primarily use email for opening tickets and many include common images in the signature that cause clutter.  It would be good to have option to click an image and flag it to not save moving forward - that could be by file name or other means like CRC.  If it can't be implemented by selecting image in the ticket, maybe an option in Project Settings to ignore by file name.
fields.summary: option to remove certain images from issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Portal only customer cannot login after site restore, and Help Center doesn't render "Forgot your password?" element when the login fails
h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 instances named example1.atlassian.net and example2.atlassian.net
 # Create a portal only customer on example1
 # Confirm the customer is able to login to example1 via customer portal
 # Export site backup at example1
 # Restore the backup to example2
 # The customer cannot login to example2 by using the same credentials
 # Login page doesn't render "Forgot your password?"
 ** !Screenshot_2017-11-02_10_26_20.png|thumbnail!
 ** !Screenshot_2017-11-02_10_26_38.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Portal only customers can login to portal even after a migration
h3. Actual Results

On migrated customer portal, portal only customers are not able to login and reset password by themselves.

Here's the response from login endpoint:
{code:javascript}
{
    "loginSucceeded": false,
    "loginError": false,
    "communicationError": false,
    "elevatedSecurityCheckShown": true,
    "captchaFailure": false,
    "loginFailedByPermissions": false,
    "passwordResetRequired": false,
    "accountLocked": false
}
{code}
Error on browser console:
{code:none}
unknown error occurred during Hermes Messages initialization
{code}
h3. Notes
 - None

h3. Workaround

Admin can manually change portal only customer's password.
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html]
fields.summary: Portal only customer cannot login and reset password after site restore

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Export feature to generate portal customer list is not working on Firefox 56.0 and IE 11.

!export.png|thumbnail!

h3.Expected Result

Download should initiate after a slight pause from clicking the export button.

h3.Current Result

Download doesn't start at all.

h3.Workaround

Use latest Chrome or Microsoft Edge. Download will start in these 2 browsers.
fields.summary: Export portal customers to CSV list not working on specific browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Condition does not work when comparing to a string.
When adding Request type to compare, it does not match.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On the workflow, on the transition to "In progress" add a Condition with the configuration below:

Field: Request Type (Customer Request Type Custom Field)
Condition: !=
Value: Any request type
Comparison Type: String

h3. Expected Results

The button to transition the status to "In progress" should not appear until the request type is changed.

h3. Actual Results

The transition appears and status can be changed.

h3. Notes

It does not work if adding the value as a number or option ID as well.
fields.summary: Condition does not work when comparing to a string

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating an email address with capital letter will not work. Connectivity log in email request log is empty:-
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-31 at 10.29.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit project email request with mixed case. For example TesT@***.atlassian.net
# Try to send email to TesT@***.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results
Email successfully go through and it will display at email request log.

h3. Actual Results
Getting bounce email :-
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-31 at 10.32.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use full lower case email.
fields.summary: Email request not working when using capital letter ( Case Sensitive )

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The portal translation doesn't seem to affect the search bar description. 

!translation.png|thumbnail!

h3.Expected Result

The search bar description should be the same language as the language set under 'Language Support' for the specific Service Desk project.

h3.Current Result

Search bar description still in English
fields.summary: Search bar in the customer portal is still showing in English despite translation

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Problem with adding inline images to a comment in Jira Service Desk when the issue is opened from the queue.

h2. How to replicate
# Open an issue from the queue (issue URL ends in projects/ABC/queues/custom/xxx/ABC-xxx).
# Try to add an inline image to the comment by copy/paste.

_Expected results:_
You can add an inline image to the comment by copy/paste
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-30 at 6.22.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 

_Current results:_
The image gets attached to the issue but the unsaved comment text is cleared, and the inline image is NOT added to the comment.
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-30 at 6.20.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Workaround

Drag-and-drop the attachment.
fields.summary: Problem adding inline image to comments when issue is opened from queue

fields.description:
h3. "E-Mail" is ok, but "Puller" means weenie ( [https://dict.leo.org/englisch-deutsch/weenie] ) in german. Even in a grown-up-only-environment its not very good understandable.

Suggestion: "E-Mail-Sammler" (fetch) or "E-Mail-Abholer" (retrieve).
fields.summary: Translating of "E-Mail-Puller" is in german adolescence humor
Widget -> Need to configurate placeholders or language localization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Looking into automatically update the Customers' passwords for the Customer Portal when the company's software updates their password is not possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a REST API call to update the customer's password.
fields.summary: Set customer account's password through REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using Safari, I am unable to see Service Desk Portal.
h4. Tested on Safari versions:

9.1.2
 10.12.6
 10.1.1
h4. Affected Versions

JIRA v1001.0.0
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk using Safari

h4. Expected Results

See Service Desk Portal.
h4. Actual Results

Blank screen
h4. Workaround

Use another browser.
fields.summary: Safari users just get a blank screen when access Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When raising a request on behalf of customers, Agents could only select the customer based on name or email address. There is no other information of the customer to be displayed in the request form to help Agents to verify the customer.

h3. Suggestion
To have some fields in the form to be retrieved from JIRA or external directory and populated when a customer is selected as the reporter. For example, 
* Phone number
* Title
* Department
* Location
* Timezone

h3. Why is it important
It helps Agents to verify the customer information, whether it's the dedicated customer or the information requires an update.
It also helps to filter customer by location.
fields.summary: Customer information to be populated in the request form

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Work Week" configuration for SLA calendar setting have extra line for "Saturday" . For example, when a day have multiple entry it should include in the same row. But, it create a new row for Saturday. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Calendar configuration
# For "Work Week" settings, add multiple entry for Saturday.

h3. Expected Results
Multiple entry should be in the same row.

h3. Actual Results
Multiple entries create a new row/line. Below is the screenshot:-
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-26 at 11.10.52 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Work Week" configuration for SLA Calendar setting have extra line

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Service Desk administrator, I would like to configure satisfaction surveys to only be sent out some of the time.  We expect a very high volume of requests to be opened and do not want a survey to be sent out for all of them. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the survey sending rate to be configurable. 
Additionally, have the ability to disable the satisfaction survey for certain resolutions. E.g: "Canceled", "Declined".
fields.summary: Ability to configure satisfaction surveys to only be sent out some of the time.

fields.description:
User don't always know what kind of tickets they are creating, sometimes a request for technical support is actually a bug report.

Not being able to change a request to any other kind of issue, e.g. with a wizard to guide through the transition, is too inflexible.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to change the type of a service ticket from "Technical Support" to "Report a bug"

fields.description:

should work the same.

Somehow /bsd now no longer works.
fields.summary: accessing project with case insensitive no longer work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When customer username is not an email , agent can't create issue using *Create* button in JIRA.

h3. Environment
* Vertigo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User Customer account that use 'name' for username ; or
* Create a customer account ( By default now, username will automatically use email)
* Edit the username to "name" in the database.
# Create issue from JIRA

h3. Expected Results
Issue get created.
h3. Actual Results
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-24 at 5.03.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Create issue from Customer Portal
fields.summary: When customer username is not an email, agent can't create issue from JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update}
This bug is also happening when there is no add-on post-functions, but for this variation,
it's still possible to re-trigger a transition and pause or stop the SLA count.

Additional workaround added to recalculate the wrong SLAs too.
{panel}
h4. Summary

An SLA metric will not stop counting when the status conditions are met if there is an add-on post-function as the last on the transition's post-functions.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Have an add-on that provides post-functions installed.
 # Have an SLA metric that the condition to stop is based on a status. (ie: "In Progress")
 # Add the add-on's post-function to the transition to "In Progress" status.
 # Make it the last post-function to run on the transition.
 # Create a ticket that will start the SLA metric.
 # Perform the transition "In Progress"

h5. Expected behaviour

The SLA metric should stop counting when the condition is met.
h5. Actual result

The SLA metric continues to count regardless of the condition being met.
h4. Notes

The issue is not consistent, around 15-20% of the tickets will not be impacted, but there is no specific difference between them.
The issue also causes the SLA to not show.
h4. Workaround

Move the add-on's post-function to an upper position on the workflow's transition.

Use this knowledge base's workaround to recalculate the wrong SLA: [Missing SLA data in JIRA ServiceDesk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-sla-data-in-jira-servicedesk-828790603.html]

h4. How to find tickets which are impacted
h5. SLA is not started
h6. Using Automation rule
When: Issue Created
If: Issue matches
{code:sql}"Time to resolution" != running(){code}
Then: (add an Internal comment/alert the user etc)
h6. Using Queues
{code:sql}"Time to first response" != running() and "Time to first response" != paused() and "Time to first response" != completed(){code}
h5. SLA is not Paused/Completed
h6. Using Automation rule (will depends on your SLA configuration)
When: Status changed 
If: Issue matches
{code:sql}status = Completed and "Time to resolution" != completed(){code}
Then: (add an Internal comment/alert the user etc)
h6. Using Queues
{code:sql}status = Completed and "Time to resolution" != completed(){code}

For more jql options go https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/using-jql-queries-specific-to-slas-844628670.html
fields.summary: SLA counter is not starting, stopping or pausing on the conditions.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a request is created via email and the reporter CC's a request participant to the email, the email will add CC'ed user as a request participant to the ticket. However, this action causes the Request Language to be updated to Unknown.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email to the Email Request email address, CC another user

h3. Expected Results

The CC'ed user is added as a Request Participant, Request Language remains to user preferences language.
h3. Actual Results

The CC'ed user is added as a Request Participant, Request Language updated to Unknown
h3. Notes

In the issue activity, you can see that the Request Language is set to a known value, eg: English, then when a request participant is added, the Request Language is updated to Unknown.

*PS: The same problem happens when you resolve the issue (Set the resolution field).*
h3. Workaround
 * A possible workaround is to use automation rules after creations to re-set issues with specific criteria to its language.
 * To avoid excessive notifications when issue creation, Disable having default assignee in a project if any and assign issues after creation via automation rules. That will result in having one notification only per issue.
fields.summary: Adding Request Participant via email or change resolution field is causing Request Language changes to Unknown

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a Service Desk project with sample data, one of the tickets description is formatted incorrectly. It specifically affects the ticket numbered 1 in the newly created project, with issue summary 'What am I looking at?'


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project with sample data
# Check the description field for ticket no. 1.

h3. Expected Results
The content of description field is shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The description field looks as follows:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The content is not suited for the wiki style renderer.

h3. Workaround

Replace the content of the description field with the following text:

{noformat}
* You are now looking at an issue in one of your preset queues. This is where your agents work on your end users' requests.
* On your left hand side are the queues where you can easily see all requests coming from your end users. 
* You can also see what this issue looks like in the Customer Portal by selecting the *View customer request* link to the right.

----
Got it? Now click *Resolve this issue* and add a comment to complete this request.
----
{noformat}
fields.summary: When creating a Service Desk with sample data, one of the tickets description is formatted incorrectly
